result.execSummary:
The defendant Kevin M Stadter was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Kevin M Stadter is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Kevin M Stadter was found guilty of False Imprisonment [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.30.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: If revoked, deft requests credit of 100 days.  Probation may be transferred to Phillips Wisconsin.  Request for expunction is denied.

miscConds.notes:
Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  
*  Pay supervision fees.  
*  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.  
*  DE is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.  
*  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.  
May not have contact with Brianna D except as allowed by order of the Domestic Relations Court.  DOC shall be prohibited from placing a no contact order on the deft between him & his child other than in an emergency situation.  However, deft will need to obtain permission from Domestic Relations to allow contact with child.  DOC shall promptly notify the Court, in writing, of any new arrest or criminal charge made against the deft.

timeConds.notes:
As a condition of probation as an ATR on 4/29/16.
Court orders deft to serve time in jail as a condition of probatioon from today to 6/8/16.  On 6/8/16, the jail is to release deft to his agent and on that day the deft will begin an inpatient treatment program as an ATR.

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Thomas Binger appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty Toni Young.  Victim rights compliance.  Sentencing arguments made.  Deft sentenced to 4yrs & 7mos WSP; initial confinement of 19mos followed by 3yrs of ES.  ES conditions to be identical to those of probation unless already satisfied.  Deft not eligible for CIP or SAP.  Appeal rights.  Court has no problem with deft serving his ES time in Price County.

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Burgoyne appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty Christopher Rose.  Case is resolved.  Victim rights compliance.  Deft pleads guilty to count 1; found guilty by the Court.  Remaining counts are dismissed on State's motion.  PSI ordered.  Sentencing set for 10/26/15 @ 2pm.
